newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Petrobras discovers two new oilfields.
newsitem.headline: Petrobras discovers two new oilfields.

text.p: Brazilian state oil giant Petrobras announced the discovery of two new oilfields in Brazil's northeastern state of Sergipe.
Petrobras said in a statement one of the oilfields is located at the mouth of the Sao Francisco River and the other is located 14 km (8.75 miles) off the coast.
The Sao Francisco River oilfield at a depth of 1,078 meters (1,179 yards) has estimated reserves of 2.2 million barrels of oil and is expected to produce 370 barrels per day (bpd), Petrobras said.
The other oilfield, 1,475 meters (1,613 yards) below sea level, holds estimated reserves of 7.0 million barrels of oil and will produce 1,500 bpd.
Sergipe state currently produces 37,400 bpd and 2 million cubic meters of natural gas per day.
((--Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151))
